pgmcomponents.elements package¶

Submodules¶

pgmcomponents.elements.grating module¶

class pgmcomponents.elements.grating.Grating(line_density=600, energy=2400, cff=2, order=1, dimensions=array([200, 40, 50]), borders=array([0, 0, 0, 0]))[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for a simple grating

Based on the work of Matthew Hand

Parameters:

  • line_density (float) – The line density of the grating in lines per mm

  • energy (float) – The energy of the incident beam in eV

  • cff (float) – The fixed focus constant of the grating

  • order (int) – The diffraction order of the grating

  • dimensions (array_like) – The dimensions of the grating in mm [length, width, height], dimensions are also accessible with lambda functions as: self._length(), self._width(), self._height()

  • borders (array_like) –

    Specifies the borders of a realistic grating component.

    |-----------Top------------| | |

    Left Grating Plane Right
    | —-> +z direction

    |----------Bottom----------| [top, bottom, left, right]

    Left - Right => Tangential Top - Bottom => Sagittal

line_density¶

The line density of the grating in lines per mm

Type:

float

energy¶

The energy of the incident beam in eV

Type:

float

cff¶

The fixed focus constant of the grating

Type:

float

The diffraction order of the grating

Type:

int

alpha¶

The incident angle of the beam in degrees

Type:

float

beta¶

The diffraction angle of the beam in degrees

Type:

float

dimensions¶

The dimensions of the grating in mm

Type:

array_like

corners¶

The corners of the grating in the global coordinate system: [bottom left back, bottom right back, bottom left front, bottom right front, top left back, top right back, top left front, top right front]

Type:

array_like

borders¶

Specifies the borders of a realistic grating component. |-----------Top------------| | |

Left Grating Plane Right
| —-> +z direction

|----------Bottom----------| [top, bottom, left, right]

Left - Right => Tangential Top - Bottom => Sagittal

Type:

array_like

compute_angles() → tuple[float, float][source]¶

Compute the incident and diffraction angles of the grating. The incident angle is calculated from the diffraction angle using the fixed focus constant.

Returns:

  • alpha (float) – The incident angle in degrees

  • beta (float) – The diffraction angle in degrees

compute_beta() → float[source]¶

Compute the diffraction angle beta from the incident angle alpha.

Returns:

beta – The diffraction angle in degrees

Return type:

float

compute_corners() → ndarray[source]¶

Compute the corners of the grating in the global coordinate system.

Returns:

corners – The corners of the grating in the global coordinate system: [bottom left back, bottom right back, bottom left front, bottom right front, top left back, top right back, top left front, top right front]

Return type:

array_like

Returns:

diffracted_rays – A list of diffracted rays

Return type:

list of Ray3D

  • raises ValueError too –

  • TypeError – If the rays are not Ray3D objects

classmethod grating_from_file(filename)[source]¶

Create a grating from a file. See config_pgm.ini for an example. A config_file may contain more than one sections, but only the grating section will be read.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the file to read from

read_file(filename)[source]¶

Read grating parameters from a file. See config_pgm.ini for an example. A config_file may contain more than one sections, but only the grating section will be read.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the file to read from

Set the incident and diffraction angles of the grating.

Parameters:

  • alpha (float) – The incident angle in degrees

  • beta (float) – The diffraction angle in degrees

Raises:

ValueError – If the wavelength is zero

pgmcomponents.elements.mirror module¶

class pgmcomponents.elements.mirror.Plane_Mirror(voffset=13, hoffset=40, axis_voffset=6.5, axis_hoffset=0, dimensions=array([450,  70,  50]), theta=45, plane=Plane(point=[0 0 0], normal=[0 0 1]), borders=array([0, 0, 0, 0]))[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for a simple plane mirror.

Parameters:

  • voffset (float, optional) – The vertical offset of the mirror in mm

  • hoffset (float, optional) – The horizontal offset of the mirror in mm

  • axis_voffset (float, optional) – The vertical offset of the mirror axis in mm

  • axis_hoffset (float, optional) – The horizontal offset of the mirror axis in mm

  • dimensions (array_like, optional) – The dimensions of the mirror in mm [length, width, height] Dimensions are also accessible with lambda functions as: self._length(), self._width(), self._height()

  • theta (float, optional) – The angle of the mirror in degrees

  • plane (Plane, optional) – The plane of the mirror

  • borders (array_like, optional) –

    Specifies the borders for a realistic plane mirror:

    borders : array_like Specifies the borders of a realistic grating component. |-----------Top------------| | |

    Left Mirror Plane Right
    | —> +z direction

    |----------Bottom----------| [top, bottom, left, right]

dimensions¶

The dimensions of the mirror in mm

Type:

array_like

position¶

The position of the mirror

Type:

Point3D

normal¶

The normal vector of the mirror

Type:

Vector3D

orientation¶

The orientation of the mirror

Type:

Vector3D

corners¶

The corners of the grating in the global coordinate system: [bottom left back, bottom right back, bottom left front, bottom right front, top left back, top right back, top left front, top right front]

Type:

array_like

plane¶

The plane of the mirror

Type:

Plane

borders¶

Specifies the borders for a realistic plane mirror: borders : array_like Specifies the borders of a realistic grating component. |-----------Top------------| | |

Left Mirror Plane Right
| —> +z direction

|----------Bottom----------| [top, bottom, left, right]

Type:

array_like

compute_corners() → ndarray[source]¶

Compute the corners of the mirror in the global coordinate system, in addition to the plane and normal of the mirror.

Returns:

corners – The corners of the mirror in the global coordinate system [bottom left back, bottom right back, bottom left front, bottom right front, top left back, top right back, top left front, top right front]

Return type:

np.ndarray

pgmcomponents.elements.pgm module¶

class pgmcomponents.elements.pgm.PGM(grating=None, mirror=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for a PGM setup.

Parameters:

  • grating (Grating) – The grating component of the PGM

  • mirror (Plane_Mirror) – The mirror component of the PGM

grating¶

The grating component of the PGM

Type:

Grating

mirror¶

The mirror component of the PGM

Type:

Plane_Mirror

rays¶

The rays to be propagated through the PGM

Type:

list

beam_offset¶

The vertical offset of the beam in mm

Type:

float

beam_width¶

The width of the beam in mm

Type:

float

beam_height¶

The height of the beam in mm

Type:

float

read_file(filename)[source]¶

Read PGM parameters from a file. See config_pgm.ini for an example. The config file should contain a grating and a mirror section.

propagate(*args)[source]¶

Propagate rays through the PGM setup.

draw_sideview(ax)[source]¶

Draws the setup on a y-z projection on a given axis.

draw_topview(ax)[source]¶

Draws the setup on a x-z projection on a given axis, along with the beam footprints.

property beam_height: float¶
property beam_offset: float¶
property beam_width: float¶
calc_footprint_size(intercepts: list[Point3D]) → tuple[source]¶

Calculate the size of the footprint of the beam on the grating or the mirror when given the intercepts of the beam with the grating or the mirror.

Parameters:

intercepts (list of Point3D objects) – The intercepts of the beam with the grating or the mirror [r_1, r_2, r_3, r_4]

Returns:

size – The size of the footprint of the beam on the grating or the mirror in mm

Return type:

tuple

centre_of_footprint()[source]¶

Calculate the centre of the footprint of the beam on the grating or the mirror.

Returns:

centre – The centre of the footprint of the beam on the grating or the mirror

Return type:

Point3D

centre_of_mirror()[source]¶

Calculate the centre of the mirror.

Returns:

centre – The centre of the mirror

Return type:

Point3D

property cff: float¶
corners() → tuple[dict][source]¶

Calculate the corners of the mirror and grating.

Returns:

corners – The corners of the grating and mirror in the following order: bottom left back, bottom right back, bottom left front, bottom right front, top left back, top right back, top left front, top right front

Return type:

dict

draw_sideview(ax: Axes)[source]¶

Draws the setup on a y-z projection on a given axis.

Parameters:

ax (matplotlib.axes) – The axis to draw on

draw_topview(ax: Axes) → None[source]¶

Draws the top-view (x-z projection) of the setup on the current axes.

Create a PGM from a file. See config_pgm.ini for an example. The config file should contain a grating and a mirror section.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the file to read from

propagate(*args: Ray3D | list) → tuple[source]¶

Propagate rays through the PGM setup.

Parameters:

*args (Ray3D) – The rays to be propagated

Returns:

  • grating_ray (list of Ray3D objects) – A list of propagated rays originating at the grating intercept

  • mirror_intercept (list of array_like) – A list of the mirror intercepts

  • grating_intercept (list of array_like) – A list of the grating intercepts
